trans-unit.source: Sets the current time zone settings

seg-source.mrk: Sets the current time zone settings

target.mrk: Sets the current time zone settings

trans-unit.source: The current bias for local time translation on this computer. The bias is the difference in minutes between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.

seg-source.mrk: The current bias for local time translation on this computer.
The bias is the difference in minutes between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.

target.mrk: The current bias for local time translation on this computer.
The bias is the difference in minutes between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.

trans-unit.source: All translations between UTC and local time use the following formula: UTC = local time + bias

seg-source.mrk: All translations between UTC and local time use the following formula:

target.mrk: All translations between UTC and local time use the following formula:

trans-unit.source: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from daylight saving time to standard time occurs.

seg-source.mrk: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from daylight saving time to standard time occurs.

target.mrk: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from daylight saving time to standard time occurs.

trans-unit.source: The bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during standard time. This value is added to the value of the Bias to form the bias used during standard time. In most time zones, this value is zero.

seg-source.mrk: The bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during standard time.
This value is added to the value of the Bias to form the bias used during standard time.
In most time zones, this value is zero.

target.mrk: The bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during standard time.
This value is added to the value of the Bias to form the bias used during standard time.
In most time zones, this value is zero.

trans-unit.source: The description for daylight saving time

seg-source.mrk: The description for daylight saving time

target.mrk: The description for daylight saving time

trans-unit.source: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs.

seg-source.mrk: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs.

target.mrk: A $tagSYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition from standard time to daylight saving time occurs.

trans-unit.source: The bias value to be used during local time translation that occur during daylight saving time. This value is added to the value of the Bias member to form the bias used during daylight saving time. In most time zones this value is –60.

seg-source.mrk: The bias value to be used during local time translation that occur during daylight saving time.
This value is added to the value of the Bias member to form the bias used during daylight saving time.
In most time zones this value is –60.

target.mrk: The bias value to be used during local time translation that occur during daylight saving time.
This value is added to the value of the Bias member to form the bias used during daylight saving time.
In most time zones this value is –60.

trans-unit.source: To select the correct day in the month, set the wYear member to zero, the wHour and wMinute members to the transition time, the wDayOfWeek member to the appropriate weekday, and the wDay member to indicate the occurrence of the day of the week within the month (1 to 5, where 5 indicates the final occurrence during the month if that day of the week does not occur 5 times).

seg-source.mrk: To select the correct day in the month, set the wYear member to zero, the wHour and wMinute members to the transition time, the wDayOfWeek member to the appropriate weekday, and the wDay member to indicate the occurrence of the day of the week within the month (1 to 5, where 5 indicates the final occurrence during the month if that day of the week does not occur 5 times).

target.mrk: To select the correct day in the month, set the wYear member to zero, the wHour and wMinute members to the transition time, the wDayOfWeek member to the appropriate weekday, and the wDay member to indicate the occurrence of the day of the week within the month (1 to 5, where 5 indicates the final occurrence during the month if that day of the week does not occur 5 times).

trans-unit.source: Using this notation, specify 02:00 on the first Sunday in April as follows: wHour = 2, wMonth = 4, wDayOfWeek = 0, wDay = 1. Specify 02:00 on the last Thursday in October as follows: wHour = 2, wMonth = 10, wDayOfWeek = 4, wDay = 5.

seg-source.mrk: Using this notation, specify 02:00 on the first Sunday in April as follows: wHour = 2, wMonth = 4, wDayOfWeek = 0, wDay = 1.
Specify 02:00 on the last Thursday in October as follows: wHour = 2, wMonth = 10, wDayOfWeek = 4, wDay = 5.

target.mrk: Using this notation, specify 02:00 on the first Sunday in April as follows: wHour = 2, wMonth = 4, wDayOfWeek = 0, wDay = 1.
Specify 02:00 on the last Thursday in October as follows: wHour = 2, wMonth = 10, wDayOfWeek = 4, wDay = 5.

trans-unit.source: Under Vista the Windows API "SetTimeZoneInformation" may be rejected due to system security

seg-source.mrk: Under Vista the Windows API "SetTimeZoneInformation" may be rejected due to system security

target.mrk: Under Vista the Windows API "SetTimeZoneInformation" may be rejected due to system security

trans-unit.source: System time zone cannot be SET

seg-source.mrk: System time zone cannot be SET

target.mrk: System time zone cannot be SET
